conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my true first choice. Given repeated rejections due to holding the seat for higher-priority applicants (especially Student_B), the best move is to submit another formal application emphasizing immediate commitment and asking them to fill the seat now if no higher-priority applicant is applying this round. This maximizes my chance to secure the top available option before the simulation ends.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest and for formally applying again. We recognize your consistent commitment to School_C, and we appreciate your patience throughout the process.

At this time, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. [ACCEPT]

Please confirm that you will enroll so we can finalize your placement.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: School_C’s true priority list is B > A > D > E > C. Student_E is acceptable but below B/A/D. However, by round 12 no higher-priority student has contacted School_C at all, and Student_E has repeatedly made a credible commitment to enroll immediately if admitted. Given the long history of holding the seat and the risk of ending unmatched (quota wasted) versus the diminishing likelihood that B/A/D will pivot to School_C (they each rank School_C 2nd/5th and may be pursuing higher choices), it is now optimal to fill the seat with the best available committed applicant. Therefore accept Student_E.
